dataset.title: Ordinary Kriging Precipitation Time Series for surrounding CAPLTER areas, 1999 to 2011

creator.organizationName: Flood Control District of Maricopa County

abstract.para: Annual rainfall data within the CAP/LTER boundary. Consists of 2 Layer Packages and tabular data. The table contains rainfall data from 2000 to 2011 based on ALERT data collection sites via The Flood Control District of Maricopa County. Included are 12 classified raster datasets displaying annual rainfall data for each year as well as point data of each ALERT collection site. Also included are city boundaries, the CAP/LTER boundary, Native American Reservation boundaries, and the location of the capital as either point or polygon datasets for a location reference.

keywordSet.keywordThesaurus: IPA and Core Area CAP Data Portal Controler

keywordSet.keyword: central arizona phoenix longterm ecological research

section.para: Copyright Board of Regents, Arizona State University. This information is released to the public and may be used for academic, educational, or commercial purposes subject to the following restrictions:

listitem.para: While CAP LTER will make every effort possible to control and document the quality of the data it publishes, the data are made available 'as is'.
CAP LTER cannot assume responsibility for damages resulting from mis-use or mis-interpretation of datasets or from errors or omissions that may exist in the data.
It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists that has resulted in data used in subsequent research.
CAP LTER expects that any use of data from this server will be accompanied with the appropriate citations and acknowledgments.

CAP LTER encourages users to contact the original investigator responsible for the data that they are accessing. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on CAP LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
CAP LTER requests that users submit to the Global Institute of Sustainability, ASU, one copy of any publication resulting from the use of data obtained from this site.
CAP LTER requests that users not redistribute data obtained from this site. However, links or references to this site may be freely posted.

description.para: This geospatial analysis has been concluded

contact.organizationName: Global Institute of Sustainability, Arizona State University

description.para: Annual precipitation was collected by ALERT station sites and was sent to GIOS after a request was sent to The Flood Control District of Maricopa County. Ordinary Kriging was used on the 305 ALERT stations data of Rainfall in Inches to create raster data for each year. Also included are the City, Native Lands, and CAP/LTER boundary polygon data as a spatial reference which was obtained from the CAP/LTER data catalog

dataTable.entityName: Time series annual rainfall from 2000 to 2011
dataTable.entityDescription: A time series of data points collect within the caplter and surrounding areas from 2000 to 2011, as reported by the Maricopa County Flood Control District.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The record identifier given by the Flood Control District of Maricopa County.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Longitude value in decimal degrees representing 1 part of the cordinate system used to define the station locations.

textDomain.definition: a decimal degree cordinate system identifier

attribute.attributeDefinition: The fixed reference point, as height above sea level.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A description of the station location where the data was collected.

textDomain.definition: a string value detailing a location

attribute.attributeDefinition: The date that the rainfall sensor station was established to collect data.

spatialRaster.entityDescription: Annual precipitation collected by ALERT station sites for The Flood Control District of Maricopa County. Ordinary Kriging was used on the 305 ALERT stations to create raster for each year. Raster values represent rainfall in inches. Data collection begins October 1st and continues to September 30th the following year.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO image file

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: General Maricopa county bounding coordinates for rain stations

attribute.attributeDefinition: the maximum number of raster objects along the ordinate (y) axis. For use with rectangular raster objects
the maximum number of raster objects along the abscissa (x) axis. For use with rectangular raster objects

parameter.description: a multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the central meridian.
parameter.name: Scale factor at central meridian

parameter.description: The line of logitude at the center of the map projection
parameter.name: Longitude at central meridian

parameter.description: The latitude chosen as center of the projection
parameter.name: Latitude of projection origin

parameter.description: A value added in a rectangular coordinate system, usually used to avoid negative values
parameter.name: False Easting

parameter.description: A value added in a rectangular coordinate system, usually used to avoid negative values
parameter.name: False Northing

spatialVector.entityName: The Alert Station Sites, as points, for the Pheonix Annual Rainfall data, 2000 to 2011
spatialVector.entityDescription: Annual rainfall data within the CAP/LTER boundary. Consists of 2 Layer Packages and tabular data. The table contains rainfall data from 2000 to 2011 based on ALERT data collection sites via The Flood Control District of Maricopa County. Included are 12 classified raster datasets displaying annual rainfall data for each year as well as point data of each ALERT collection site. Also included are city boundaries, the CAP/LTER boundary, Native American Reservation boundaries, and the location of the capital as either point or polygon datasets for a location reference.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: General Maricopa county bounding coordinates for rain stations
